body_html: In case anybody stumbles across this in the future I thought I would mention that if you get into the habit of calling graph.finalize() after defining the static graph, you will always be presented with an exception if nodes are added to the graph when you aren't expecting them rather than running into an exploding memory problem.
body_text: In case anybody stumbles across this in the future I thought I would mention that if you get into the habit of calling graph.finalize() after defining the static graph, you will always be presented with an exception if nodes are added to the graph when you aren't expecting them rather than running into an exploding memory problem.
body: In case anybody stumbles across this in the future I thought I would mention that if you get into the habit of calling `graph.finalize()` after defining the static graph, you will always be presented with an exception if nodes are added to the graph when you aren't expecting them rather than running into an exploding memory problem.
